meanings.definition: A rounded underground storage organ present in some plants, consisting of a short stem surrounded by fleshy scale leaves or leaf bases.
meanings.sent1: Tulip bulbs are planted in the fall and bloom in the spring.
meanings.sent2: The gardener carefully dug up the bulbs to divide and replant them.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel mistook the bulbs for acorns and buried them all over the garden.
meanings.sent4: Her ideas were like bulbs waiting to sprout into beautiful flowers of creativity.
meanings.sent5: The bulbs stored all the nutrients for the plant to grow strong and healthy.

meanings.definition: A light bulb, especially one that is electric.
meanings.sent1: The room was dark until she turned on the bulbs overhead.
meanings.sent2: He replaced the burnt-out bulbs in the lamp with new ones.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked that his brain needed new bulbs to have bright ideas.
meanings.sent4: The city skyline at night was a sea of glowing bulbs, like stars on Earth.
meanings.sent5: The bulbs illuminated the path, guiding them through the darkness.
